dd1a9320-8851-4266-a921-fe2b38831762.description: The Worldchefs Certified Continental Judge level represents mid-level culinary professionals with some judging experience, including competitors with silver medal performance and/or a minimum of two years in a high-end restaurant environment. The Worldchefs Certified Continental Judge level has replaced the former B Judge level.
dd1a9320-8851-4266-a921-fe2b38831762.name: Worldchefs Hot Kitchen & Culinary Arts : Continental Judge

badge_template_activities.title: The application form must be signed and sealed by the applicant's local chefs association President as well as the Worldchefs national association president in the applicant's country.
The national association must be a financial member of Worldchefs.
The applicant must have participated in a qualifying Worldchefs Competition Seminar within the last five (5) years.
The applicant provides a resume or brief bio explaining their position in the kitchen as a Chef, a Food Service Manager, or a Chef Educator in a culinary school.
Two (2) letters of recommendation from two (2) Worldchefs Certified Judges from different countries.
The applicant have been a Regional Judge or a Rookie Judge at two (2) major Worldchefs events.
The applicant provides a bio on competition experience as a competitor or as a member of the jury.

The applicant provides proof that they have competed in a competition as a team member or as an individual with a minimum performance standard of a silver medal OR Provide references that they have worked in a high-end restaurant for a minimum of two (2) years OR Have been a senior lecturer in a culinary school for a minimum of five (5) years.
The applicant confirms that they can communicate at a reasonable level in English.
The applicant must be up-to-date with the Worldchefs Food & Hygiene Regulations.

In case of applying for a Pastry, Vegan / Plant Base Cuisine, Community Catering or Carving recognition as a judge, the applicant must have completed a Worldchefs Competiton Seminar relevant to that craft.
The applicant must understand the Worldchefs ‘Code of Conduct’.

badge_template_activities.title: The application form must be signed and sealed by the applicant's local chefs association President as well as the Worldchefs national association president in the applicant's country.
The national association must be a financial member of Worldchefs in good standing.
The applicant must have participated in a qualifying Worldchefs Competition Seminar within the last 5 years
The applicant provide a resume and brief bio explaining their position in the kitchen as a Chef, a Food Service Manager, or a Chef Educator in a culinary school.
Two (2) letters of recommendation from two (2) accredited Worldchefs Certified International Judges from different countries
The applicant has been a Continental Jury member at FOUR (4) Worldchefs events and two (2) of these must be Continental events in the past five (5) years (allowing for COVID-19).
The applicant provides a bio on competition experience as a competitor or as a member of the jury

The applicant provides proof that they have competed in a competition as a team member in a National Team or Regional Team and achieve a minimum of silver medal standards OR provide references that they have worked in a Michelin-starred restaurant or equivalent high-end establishment for a minimum of five (5) years OR they have been a senior lecturer in a culinary school for a minimum of ten (10) years.
The applicant confirms that they can communicate at a reasonable level in English OR are willing to have their own translator at their expense, preferably with a culinary background.
The applicant must be up to date with the Worldchefs Food & Hygiene Regulations

In case of applying for a Pastry, Vegan / Plant Base Cuisine, Community Catering or Carving recognition as a judge, the applicant must have completed a Worldchefs Competition Seminar relevant to that craft.
The applicant must understand the Worldchefs ‘Code of Conduct’

badge_template_activities.title: The In Classroom Judges scoring will be mainly measured by three aspects: Hygiene, Work Preparation and Taste; while Online Judges scoring will be judged upon two dimensions: Presentation and Recipe. After two rounds of scoring, the contestants will be awarded digital badges, issued by Worldchefs, according to their scores. 100 will be awarded with Gold with Distinction, 90-99 will be awarded with Gold Medal, 80-89 will be awarded with Silver Medal whereas 70-79 will be awarded with Bronze Medal

badge_template_activities.title: The application form must be signed and sealed by the applicant's local chefs association President as well as the Worldchefs national association president in the applicant's country.
The national association must be a financial member of Worldchefs.
The applicant must have participated in a qualifying Worldchefs Competition Seminar within the last five (5) years.
The applicant provides a resume or brief bio explaining their position in the kitchen as a Chef, a Food Service Manager, or a Chef Educator in a culinary school.
Two (2) letters of recommendation from two (2) Worldchefs Certified Judges from different countries.
The applicant have been a Regional Judge or a Rookie Judge at two (2) major Worldchefs events.
The applicant provides a bio on competition experience as a competitor or as a member of the jury.

The applicant provides proof that they have competed in a competition as a team member or as an individual with a minimum performance standard of a silver medal OR Provide references that they have worked in a high-end restaurant for a minimum of two (2) years OR Have been a senior lecturer in a culinary school for a minimum of five (5) years.
The applicant confirms that they can communicate at a reasonable level in English.
The applicant must be up-to-date with the Worldchefs Food & Hygiene Regulations.

In case of applying for a Pastry, Vegan / Plant Base Cuisine, Community Catering or Carving recognition as a judge, the applicant must have completed a Worldchefs Competiton Seminar relevant to that craft.
The applicant must understand the Worldchefs ‘Code of Conduct’.

badge_template_activities.title: The application form must be signed and sealed by the applicant's local chefs association President as well as the Worldchefs national association president in the applicant's country.
The national association must be a financial member of Worldchefs in good standing.
The applicant must have participated in a qualifying Worldchefs Competition Seminar within the last 5 years
The applicant provide a resume and brief bio explaining their position in the kitchen as a Chef, a Food Service Manager, or a Chef Educator in a culinary school.
Two (2) letters of recommendation from two (2) accredited Worldchefs Certified International Judges from different countries
The applicant has been a Continental Jury member at FOUR (4) Worldchefs events and two (2) of these must be Continental events in the past five (5) years (allowing for COVID-19).
The applicant provides a bio on competition experience as a competitor or as a member of the jury

The applicant provides proof that they have competed in a competition as a team member in a National Team or Regional Team and achieve a minimum of silver medal standards OR provide references that they have worked in a Michelin-starred restaurant or equivalent high-end establishment for a minimum of five (5) years OR they have been a senior lecturer in a culinary school for a minimum of ten (10) years.
The applicant confirms that they can communicate at a reasonable level in English OR are willing to have their own translator at their expense, preferably with a culinary background.
The applicant must be up to date with the Worldchefs Food & Hygiene Regulations

In case of applying for a Pastry, Vegan / Plant Base Cuisine, Community Catering or Carving recognition as a judge, the applicant must have completed a Worldchefs Competition Seminar relevant to that craft.
The applicant must understand the Worldchefs ‘Code of Conduct’

74efb5e9-1c99-4443-9966-87a85d065427.description: The Worldchefs Certified Regional Judge level is designed for culinary competition jurors with a local scope not just limited to regional areas but also International areas where the applicant's language or cuisine may be featured. This is a stepping stone to the next level.
74efb5e9-1c99-4443-9966-87a85d065427.name: Worldchefs Pastry Arts : Regional Judge

badge_template_activities.title: The application form must be signed and sealed by the applicant's local chefs association President as well as Worldchefs national association president in the applicant's country.
The local chefs association must be a financial member of Worldchefs or a sub-branch of the national member.
The national body of the applicant's country must also be a financial member and in good standing.
The applicant must have participated in a qualifying Worldchefs Competition Seminar within the last five (5) years.
The applicant provides a resume or brief bio explaining their position in the kitchen as a Chef, a Food Service Manager, or a Chef Educator in a culinary school.

The applicant provides proof that they have competed in a competition as a team member or as an individual OR Provides references that they have worked in a high-end restaurant for a minimum of two (2) years OR Have been a senior lecturer in a culinary school for a minimum of five (5) years
The applicant provides proof that they have judged at a local regional or national competition or have been a Rookie Judge at a Worldchefs endorsed competition
The applicant must be up-to-date with the Worldchefs Food & Hygiene Regulations.
The applicant must understand the Worldchefs ‘Code of Conduct’.

5276b466-4fef-426a-b6f1-fdd3de6a91f2.description: Our mission is to reach out to our members worldwide to drive and encourage the development of Young Chefs Clubs while mentoring our Global Young Chef Ambassadors to develop and deliver initiatives such as the Young Chef Culinary Culture Exchange Program and Bill Gallagher Yong Chefs Forum. Guided by our four pillars – Friendship, Education, Cuisine, and Culture, we provide mentoring support to our global network of Young Chefs Clubs.

053b0f00-e64a-451d-be1f-708828d68e41.description: The Worldchefs Certified Continental Judge level represents mid-level culinary professionals with some judging experience, including competitors with silver medal performance and/or a minimum of two years in a high-end restaurant environment. The Worldchefs Certified Continental Judge level has replaced the former B Judge level.
053b0f00-e64a-451d-be1f-708828d68e41.name: Worldchefs Carving : Continental Judge

badge_template_activities.title: The application form must be signed and sealed by the applicant's local chefs association President as well as the Worldchefs national association president in the applicant's country.
The national association must be a financial member of Worldchefs.
The applicant must have participated in a qualifying Worldchefs Competition Seminar within the last five (5) years.
The applicant provides a resume or brief bio explaining their position in the kitchen as a Chef, a Food Service Manager, or a Chef Educator in a culinary school.
Two (2) letters of recommendation from two (2) Worldchefs Certified Judges from different countries.
The applicant have been a Regional Judge or a Rookie Judge at two (2) major Worldchefs events.
The applicant provides a bio on competition experience as a competitor or as a member of the jury.

The applicant provides proof that they have competed in a competition as a team member or as an individual with a minimum performance standard of a silver medal OR Provide references that they have worked in a high-end restaurant for a minimum of two (2) years OR Have been a senior lecturer in a culinary school for a minimum of five (5) years.
The applicant confirms that they can communicate at a reasonable level in English.
The applicant must be up-to-date with the Worldchefs Food & Hygiene Regulations.

In case of applying for a Pastry, Vegan / Plant Base Cuisine, Community Catering or Carving recognition as a judge, the applicant must have completed a Worldchefs Competiton Seminar relevant to that craft.
The applicant must understand the Worldchefs ‘Code of Conduct’.

39eb03a3-f9c8-49d8-bb2d-a940d07af97a.description: The Worldchefs Certified Regional Judge level is designed for culinary competition jurors with a local scope not just limited to regional areas but also International areas where the applicant's language or cuisine may be featured. This is a stepping stone to the next level.
39eb03a3-f9c8-49d8-bb2d-a940d07af97a.name: Worldchefs Carving : Regional Judge

badge_template_activities.title: The application form must be signed and sealed by the applicant's local chefs association President as well as Worldchefs national association president in the applicant's country.
The local chefs association must be a financial member of Worldchefs or a sub-branch of the national member.
The national body of the applicant's country must also be a financial member and in good standing.
The applicant must have participated in a qualifying Worldchefs Competition Seminar within the last five (5) years.
The applicant provides a resume or brief bio explaining their position in the kitchen as a Chef, a Food Service Manager, or a Chef Educator in a culinary school.

The applicant provides proof that they have competed in a competition as a team member or as an individual OR Provides references that they have worked in a high-end restaurant for a minimum of two (2) years OR Have been a senior lecturer in a culinary school for a minimum of five (5) years
The applicant provides proof that they have judged at a local regional or national competition or have been a Rookie Judge at a Worldchefs endorsed competition
The applicant must be up-to-date with the Worldchefs Food & Hygiene Regulations.
The applicant must understand the Worldchefs ‘Code of Conduct’.

313033fd-b019-44ca-8ae1-51b0c4783d2d.description: Worldchefs Congress & Expo brings together chef delegates and professionals from across the five continents to network and expands their professional bonds. 3b56e333-b779-43c4-b25a-cd18bbac4d97.description: The Global Young Chefs Challenge features the emerging talent of chefs who are born after Jan 1st 1995.
